abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Fourth Economic Reform
            Support Grant Project for Burundi were as follows: outcomes
            were moderately satisfactory, risk to development outcome
            was substantial, Bank performance was satisfactory, and
            Borrower performance was moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: the programmatic series of
            development policy operations (DPOs) in a fragile political
            and economic setting has served as a useful instrument to
            progress toward the intended program results. More efforts
            are needed, during program preparation, to evaluate the
            political feasibility of the reform agenda and the capacity
            of national institutions to implement the reforms.
            Institutional development and structural reforms should be
            outward looking and take into account evolving global
            developments. Engaging the civil society in supporting the
            reform agenda is feasible only if the population is
            confident that the government serves adequately national
            interests and does not discriminate. There is the need for a
            comprehensive approach to sector reforms, combining
            essential policy measures with investments designed to
            exploit the benefits of improved policies.
